definition: to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: And Im sure Parker works her socks off .
sentences.chinese: 我確信帕克工作非常賣命。

sentences.english: Be he sick or well, he works entirely hard.
sentences.chinese: 無論是生病還是身體健康，他都會賣命地工作。

sentences.english: She works so hard that she is often neglectful of her family.
sentences.chinese: 她工作非常賣命，常常連家都忘了。

sentences.english: Each relevant department is respoible for specific implementation.
sentences.chinese: 各相關部份賣命詳細施行。

sentences.english: The workers worked themselves to the bone for the capitalists.

definition: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to charge and break through enemy lines
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to force someone to do something
to be reluctant to give up a post
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
